I want to inspire my students to love learning . Please help us make this a fun year.

proposals.title: Literacy and Movement: A Perfect Combination!
proposals.shortDescription: New England winters can get very cold and snowy resulting in a lot of "indoor recess." We need books that combine movement and literacy so that we can READ and MOVE indoors during the winter...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need a collection of books to combine literacy and movement!
proposals.synopsis: New England winters can get very cold and snowy resulting in a lot of "indoor recess."  We need books that combine movement and literacy so that we can READ and MOVE indoors during the winter months! <br/><br/>Over 80% of our students come from disadvantaged backgrounds. Many of these children don't have access to the selection of reading materials that children from more affluent families take for granted. Our children have a great hunger for knowledge, but often lack the materials to fulfill this appetite.  <br/><br/>We are requesting a collection of books that are read aloud AND allow for movement.  For example...  the book "From Head to Toe," by Eric Carle, is a book that has pictures of beloved animals doing movements with parts of their bodies.  When children are invited to join in with moving the corresponding parts of their bodies, the book suddenly comes alive!  Read aloud time becomes an opportunity to move in a fun way!  Each of the books on the list was specially selected for its way of allowing teachers to introduce movement into read aloud time. <br/><br/>Demographics should not equal destiny. Although my students may come from disadvantaged backgrounds and don't always have access to the latest resources, they have a desire to reach for the stars. Having a book collection like this could make a real difference.

proposals.title: Anchor Our Learning!
proposals.shortDescription: It seems that every year, our students need to learn and retain more information. Visual aides help students to retain all of this new knowledge and we need the supplies to help us create anchor...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need poster pads, markers, and task cards to help create anchor charts for daily lessons and review.
proposals.synopsis: It seems that every year, our students need to learn and retain more information. Visual aides help students to retain all of this new knowledge and we need the supplies to help us create anchor charts and review materials. <br/><br/>We are a very low income kindergarten through fifth grade school in a small town. Our classes are large and our resources are limited. We are classified as a very low-income school and we try to be as resourceful and creative as we can. We have the basic supplies, but we need help acquiring the special extras that really help students excel. Our classes have been expanding this year as we absorb students from a school that closed. This is increasing our need for supplies more than ever. <br/><br/>When I introduce a new topic, I like to have my students help me organize the information into graphic organizers that can help them make more sense of the Common Core Standards we are studying. I would love to have supplies like the requested repositionable poster paper, bright markers of different sizes, and standards cards with student friendly "I can..." statements available to help gain more interest and illustrate what we're learning. We can leave the chart paper on the requested easel or post it somewhere around the room for easy review while working on the practice sheets from the Common Core review books.  <br/><br/>My kids love to draw and create visual aides to remember all their new information, but we just don't have the necessary supplies at this time.  This project will provide the supplies to help us create anchor charts with bright and attention grabbing colors, display the anchor charts easily, and enable us to have our Common Core standards posted in a handy tabletop pocket chart for quick review.  I would love to have a way to keep our materials posted like this all the time for my students to reference whenever needed.

proposals.title: Harlem Renaissance
proposals.shortDescription: I am an elementary school teacher/librarian and I want to help the classroom teacher do justice to their unit on the Harlem Renaissance. The students are really enthusiastic when learning about...

proposals.synopsis: I am an elementary school teacher/librarian and I want to help the classroom teacher do justice to their unit on the Harlem Renaissance. The students are really enthusiastic when learning about history involving the arts. <br/><br/>Our school is in a small southern town, and we serve approximately 475 third through fifth grade students. Around 15% of our population lives below the poverty line. Our teachers are trying their best to provide the best education possible with limited resources. When students come into the library, they are so excited to be able to check out 2 books and keep them for 2 weeks. Every year the 5th grade does a unit on the Harlem Renaissance, and the students love to get involved in the lessons and not just listen to the teacher talk. Our students love to learn and devour anything related to music, art, and dance. <br/><br/>The books' main purpose would to be supplemental resources for the 5th grade Harlem Renaissance unit. They study the artists, photographers, dancers, and musicians of the time period. Students can also use these books for pleasure reading if they choose to check them out. They will use these books to obtain knowledge about the time period where Harlem experienced a rebirth of African American talent. <br/><br/>These books will allow students to gain a better understanding of the Harlem Renaissance. With the addition of Common Core State Standards, supplemental texts are needed besides the text book. Students will be exposed to the artists, musicians, photographers, and dancers of the era.

proposals.title: Art & Science Wars
proposals.shortDescription: Have you ever heard of Storage Wars or Restaurant Wars? Well our class has Art and Science Wars! It is a friendly competition to get students to think outside of the box when they are working on...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need a variety of stencils so they can express their personalities on their projects. They also need graduated cylinders and bulbs for our heat lamps.
proposals.synopsis: Have you ever heard of Storage Wars or Restaurant Wars? Well our class has Art and Science Wars! It is a friendly competition to get students to think outside of the box when they are working on projects. They choose their partners or decide to work by themselves. We have had some amazing projects. <br/><br/>Our school is in coastal south Georgia, located right beside a large military base. Due to the large military population that our school serves, we have a very diverse population of multicultural students. These military students also tend to be very transient which can be hard on them adjusting, as well as catching up. Many students come from a very high poverty home situation, and this puts a strain on many of the families in trying to support our school financially. However, they still support us fully in ensuring every student is college or career ready. Our school serves over 1800 students with a high percentage on free and reduced price lunch. <br/><br/>If you were competing, would you want yours to look like everyone else's. No way! So my students are always asking if I have other stencils. So I would love to give them more to choose from!   We also need replacement bulbs for our heat lamps that we use in several of our labs. The graduated cylinders have been in major need since we have so many science teachers, there usually are not enough to go around and we are always waiting for someone else to finish a lab before we can use them. So often times, labs go undone due to the limited amounted of supplies. <br/><br/>Can you please help our students get the graduated cylinder sets that we need to be able to do multiple labs? We also need heat lamp bulbs to replace our blown ones. Our students are wanting to win our version of our art and science wars by allowing their personalities to shine in our competition. Can you help our students bring their personalities and knowledge out in the best ways possible? Help be a part of our art and science wars!

proposals.title: No Wires, Please!
proposals.shortDescription: Our technology is outdated. Our class speaker system is old and clumsy with wires sticking out in every direction. Trying to transfer wire connection to and from the iPad to the computer is...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need a wireless Bluetooth speaker to listen to music, audio books & learning videos without the dangers of wires and with the mobility it will provide.
proposals.synopsis:
Our technology is outdated. Our class speaker system is old and clumsy with wires sticking out in every direction. Trying to transfer wire connection to and from the iPad to the computer is extremely time consuming and plagued with technical difficulties at every use. <br/><br/>I have 25 of the smartest, most creative five year olds in the world.  They are all eager to learn and always ready for the next learning adventure.  Our school is located just east of Los Angeles in a predominantly Latino community.   More than half of our student population qualifies for free or reduced price lunch.   Most parents are hardworking people trying their best to provide all their children need to succeed in school.   Volunteer hours and support at home is what many families can and do give. Unfortunately, monetary support to the school in not possible for the majority.  Our community also has the largest population of foster children in Los Angeles school county.  Many grandparents on fixed incomes are taking the responsibility of raising their grandchildren.  With more and more cuts to our school budget, we teachers struggle to provide the basic needs of our students.   Please help me do just that. <br/><br/>Music and movement are avenues to learning in any kindergarten class. Little ones love and need both.   Whether it be an audio book, a sing along or a step by step dance program, kindergarten learning is enhanced by the sounds of language in any form.  A speaker system that works would be invaluable.  

The wireless feature will allow us to be mobile.   We will no longer be limited by wires or plugs.   The bluetooth feature will allow music and movement to follow wherever the lesson and learning may lead us. Even outdoors! <br/><br/>Music and movement provide countless opportunities for kindergarten learning.  From letters and sounds to mastering science concepts, music can make the most complex concepts accessible.  Songs and dance make the learning fun.   With a wireless speaker my students can experience this first hand.   Please donate to fund our project today.

proposals.title: The Tango Lesson: From Buenos Aires to Philadelphia
proposals.shortDescription: My students will travel vicariously to Texas, Mexico, San Juan, Ecuador and Spain through the pages of a textbook. To enliven the journey, I want to give the girls in my classes an opportunity to...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need a tango performance and lesson, to appreciate the art, dance and culture of Latin America.
proposals.synopsis:
My students  travel vicariously to Texas, Mexico, San Juan, Ecuador and Spain through the pages of a textbook. To enliven the journey, I want to give the girls in my classes an opportunity to see tango performed live- in person and up close! It's a cultural experience they will remember forever. <br/><br/>My high school is a college preparatory, all girls high school located in a large urban city. Many of my students have not traveled anywhere beyond the borders of their neighborhoods. Whether the reason is safety, or lack of interest, I want my girls to learn to appreciate the art and drama of other cultures. It is extremely important for them to have a cultural appreciation for groups of people who do not talk like them, eat the same foods, or even speak the same language. Dance is the unifying thread for my students.

Tango is the dance expression of a country that has blossomed world wide. There is history, politics, language, race, and censorship connected to this dance that was once performed by men only. While my students enjoy dance, I believe this would be a totally unique and new experience for them. Women can be leaders as well as followers in tango. This alone makes it a unique approach for raising self esteem and encouraging the girls to go out into the world prepared. <br/><br/>My students are freshman and sophomores in a college preparatory high school in Philadelphia. They are always attentive when there is dance and movement. In our unit on Spain and Lorca, they were mesmerized by flamenco. I hope to convey that appreciation for tango as they watch a live performance. 

Tango is a dance that combines European and African cultures. The music itself is a combination of various types of music from Europe. During the Depression in the 1930's and again in the 1950's in Argentina, dictators banned public gathering and so, tango was prohibited. Today it is considered an "intangible cultural heritage" by UNESCO. 

I think this is an interesting lesson for students to be aware of- that a public gathering of people historically has been banned in some countries. Imagine that this dance once provoked  fear and censorship. Tango was an art form that was provocative, popular and feared by dictators. <br/><br/>It is very important that the students are exposed to cultures that are unique from their own. Our city is a city of neighborhoods. Often, my students do not have an opportunity to experience the sounds, music, or art of other cultures. Language can be a barrier. 

Learning about tango and watching a performance would be a step in opening the minds and hearts of young students. We are a fast paced world of Internet and texting- the personal connection is often left out. This would correct that.

proposals.title: Speaker
proposals.shortDescription: CD players are a technology of the past. Nowadays the way to play music is from music files. I would like to incorporate this technology in our classroom. My students are 5 and 6 year-old children...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need a wireless speaker and iPad stand.
proposals.synopsis: CD players are a technology of the past.  Nowadays the way to play music is from music files.  I would like to incorporate this technology in our classroom.   <br/><br/>My students are 5 and 6 year-old children who live in a low socio-economic community. All my students are English language learners. They are great kids, but many times have to deal with difficult situations in their lives. Though our school may not be located in a great area, we work hard to give our students an inviting place to learn, a chance to experience new and memorable things, and create an opportunity for a better life. <br/><br/>Music is a big part of a kindergarten class.  The wireless speaker I am requesting will allow me to bring more music into the classroom.  Currently, if I want to play music for my students, I have to burn the playlist onto a CD.  With a wireless speaker, I can play music directly from my Mac or iPad.  I will not have bother with connecting chords and wires.  I will also be able to show my students videos and connect the sounds to the wireless speaker so that all students can hear clearly.  The iPad stand will also make the music more accessible.   <br/><br/>Having the wireless speaker will help make our classroom more updated in technology.  Students will enjoy listening to their favorite tunes and poems anywhere in school.  The iPad stand will also make using the iPad easier for students to use during their center time.

proposals.title: The Next Musical Prodigy? Mozart was FOUR.
proposals.shortDescription: I want to make a difference through music...<br />"A study of 106 preschool children found that those exposed to a systematic and integrated music program significantly increased their motor,...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need Music CDs to keep active, in both English and Spanish.
proposals.synopsis:
I want to make a difference through music...
"A study of 106 preschool children found that those exposed to a systematic and integrated music program significantly increased their motor, cognitive, language, and social-emotional scores as assessed by the Preschool Evaluation Scale (McCarney, 1992)." <br/><br/>I teach Pre-K at an Early Childhood Center, which is part of the Illinois public schools. Our Center is a very special place that tailors everything around the children ages 3-5, most of whom come from low-income homes. We have many different ethnic groups in our school, but the majority of our students are Hispanic. We have six preschool classrooms, which serve all types of children with various types of abilities and learning needs. <br/><br/>Each classroom would receive 2 Cd's, to be enjoyed by 190 students that we currently serve and many future students as well.
Music will help our students with the following: Early Literacy- Following a rhythm helps develop pre-reading skills, Listening- Listening to different tempos and melodies encourages auditory development, Math- Repeating patterns, sequencing, Movement- Helps develop motor coordination, Transitions- Can make moving from one activity to the next easy and fun for children, Self Esteem- There is no right or wrong in music and it nurtures self-confidence, and much, much more. <br/><br/>I chose music in my students' native language as well as well as their second language because they will be great resources in helping to develop their literacy skills, among many others, in both languages. Not only will they help develop multiple skills, but it will also show the children that we respect, welcome, and embrace their culture at school.

proposals.title: Take A Stand! A Stand For The Puppets!
proposals.shortDescription: Kindergarten students can be so creative. They take risks older students do not take ... they are not inhibited by their peers or expectations. They love to create their own stories and enjoy...
proposals.fulfillmentTrailer: My students need a fabulous stand so puppets can be displayed for the themes we are studying and so students can access the puppets easily.  Creativity = Learning!
proposals.synopsis:
Kindergarten students can be so creative. They take risks older students do not take ... they are not inhibited by their peers or expectations.  They love to create their own stories and enjoy dramatic play and my students especially love when I put on a puppet show for them! <br/><br/>My kindergarten students are amazing!  They come to school every day so excited to explore and learn!  They use the materials in the classroom to discover their own talents and to further their own knowledge in all subjects.  They enjoy discovering new words as they read the big books, creating numbers using our base ten materials and explaining science concepts using concrete objects.  Many of my students come from low income homes where learning materials are not available and most of the students in my class are English Language Learners.  The students participate in all learning activities without complaint because of their desire to learn, even when the tasks are difficult for them.  

My students work very hard but their favorite time of the day is Free Choice Exploration Centers where they are allowed to choose a center to explore: dramatic play, painting, art, computers, blocks and building, puzzles, tactile play (water, play dough, etc) and puppets.   <br/><br/>If you were in our classroom in the afternoon, you would see children excited about learning while they worked in exploration centers.  Students choose from a variety of centers including dramatic play, art, science, and PUPPETS.   I would like to be able to "showcase" the puppets for the themes we are learning about in the classroom on a puppet stand so the puppets are easily accessible for the children. We have a puppet stage and I have collected numerous puppets that they can choose from.  These puppets are located in boxes and bags that require the students to dig in and find the puppets they want to use, in which they often only choose what is on top of the pile and don't explore all that is available. It seems that digging through the bins inhibits their full, creative use of the puppet center.  If we had a puppet stand I could display the puppets, therefore making the puppet center more attractive for students to create their own stories and plays.  Drama is so important! <br/><br/>By donating a puppet stand to our classroom, students will choose to explore the dramatic play/puppet center more often.  Having the puppets displayed for them will make it more likely they will participate in creating dramas and plays using puppets of animals and people that we are learning about in science, social studies and literature.  Using familiar materials will further their learning.  Dramatic play is an important aspect of learning for young students and a wonderful creative outlet!
